results.title: T.V. commercials: Shell trio
results.brief_description: A series of three commercials which established the “Go Well - Go Shell” theme for one year. The three commercials vary in mood and approach. Individual titles are “Theme”, “Rain” and “Coast road”.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Mobil circle of safety
results.creator_credit: George Patterson Creative Group and Mobil Oil Australia
results.brief_description: A series of television commercials made with the aim of promoting road safety and advertising the mechanical safety services available from the Mobil service stations. The nine commercials include: Swinging tyres, Traffic trauma, Eye, Cannonball, Queue, Go back, Cosmos, Belt up and Playground. Intellegent copy and strong images reinforce the message as well as the oil company’s logo.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Hushpower

results.title: T.V. commercials: four types
results.brief_description: A series of commercials using different approaches: hard sell, with emphasis on product and brand name; hard sell message with soft sell approach; soft sell, in which the emphasis is not solely on the product; and the testimonial technique for viewer identification. Products featured: Tarax, ANZ Christmas Club, ANZ Travel, Export Action, ANZ Cheque Account, Sidchrome.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Dulux
results.creator_credit: Senior Film Productions and George Patterson Creative Group
results.brief_description: Presents two 60-second commercials with an identical tag line: “The one paint good enough”. Illustrates the paint company’s product in old and new settings: Como House in Melbourne and a new jet airliner for Trans Australia Airlines.

results.title: T.E. Lawrence
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Malcolm Brown and Philip Donnellan
results.brief_description: Portrait of “Lawrence of Arabia” a profoundly controversial figure with a reputation swinging between hero worship on the one hand and contempt on the other. Tells the story of his life and death (1935) with the richest and most authentic material available in the hope that a real and credible Lawrence will emerge. Original photographs, drawings of Eric Kennington, and mementos from friends are used. Written and narrated by David Lytton, voice of T.E. Lawrence by Cyril Cusack.

results.title: T is for Tumbleweed
results.creator_credit: Camera Eye Pictures, James A. Lebenthal and Louis Clyde Stoumen
results.brief_description: Portrays without commentary the racing, creeping, leaping travels of a tumbleweed and the encounters it has with people, animals and things. Photographed by Haskell Wexler.

results.title: T for teacher
results.brief_description: A cartoon all about a cup of tea, telling in amusing rhymes and sketches, how not to make a cup of tea, and some simple rules for making a good “cuppa”.

results.title: T-Minus 4 years, 9 months, 30 days
results.creator_credit: CBS News, David Buksbaum, William Crawford, Arthur Kane, Ben Hill, Robert Vitarelli and Joel Banow
results.brief_description: Interviewer Walter Cronkite speaks to John Glenn about Saturn booster rockets and Dr Von Braun on the fuel and engines in the rockets. John Glenn, using a scale model, shows how astronauts will make observations on the moon, return from its surface in the Lunar Module and rendezvous with the Command Module before returning to earth.
